Fedora - a package is in Fedora (thanks to Michel Alexandre Salim), so just do: # yum install zeroinstall-injector
Newer versions are also available:
Fedora 10 RPMs
Fedora 11 RPMs
Fedora 12 RPMs

OpenSUSE 10.3 RPMs
OpenSUSE 11.0 RPMs
OpenSUSE 11.1 RPMs
OpenSUSE 11.2 RPMs
Note: do not install the -test RPMs

Debian/oldstable (etch) (Debian package; python-central)
Debian/stable (lenny) Zero Install is part of the main Debian archive, so you can get it with: # apt-get install zeroinstall-injector
Anders F Björklund has made a repository with backports of later versions to Debian/stable. Add this to sources.list to use it: deb http://afb.users.sourceforge.net/zero-install/debian lenny main

Ubuntu (feisty/gutsy/hardy/intrepid/jaunty/karmic/lucid) Zero Install is in all recent versions of Ubuntu, so you can just do: $ sudo apt-get install zeroinstall-injector
You can also install your distribution's version clicking here. If you want a newer version, the Debian/unstable package should also work on Ubuntu.
Knoppix 5 works using the Debian package; use apt-get update; apt-get install -f to fetch the dependencies
Nokia 770 zeroinstall-injector_0.19_arm.deb download page (Nokia 770 Debian package contributed by Niklas Höglund; Python 2.4)
Arch Linux zeroinstall-injector is available with Arch Linux.

Slackware 10.2 (Slackware 10.2 package) (contributed by Peter Santoro)
Slackware 12 (Slackware 12 package) (contributed by MilkaJinka)
GoboLinux instructions (anyone want to create a recipe?)

html.p: If an injector package for your distribution is listed above, install that and then try using it! Otherwise, get the source package instead!
